title: The US doesn’t have universal health care — but these states (almost) do
excerpt: Ten states have uninsured rates below 5 percent. What are they doing right?

title: Study: More Than 335,000 Lives Could Have Been Saved During Pandemic if U.S. Had Universal Health Care
excerpt: If the U.S. had had a single-payer universal health care system in 2020, nearly 212,000 American lives would have been saved that year, according to a new study

title: In the Tales Told by Sewage, Public Health and Privacy Collide
excerpt: Sewage epidemiology has been embraced in other countries for decades, but not in the U.S. Will Covid change that?

title: Opting Out of Vaccines Should Opt You Out of American Society
excerpt: People who are able to take vaccines but refuse to do so are the moral equivalent of drunk drivers
